nodes.name: AI Agent
nodes.notes: Pinyin + Example

options.systemMessage:
# Role
You are a helpful translation agent that will help users to extract the pinyin from Chinese characters to create flashcard for language learning.

# Context
You will receive a word or sentence in simplified Chinese characters; you are expected to extract the pinyin and generate a simple sentence in Chinese to illustrate the sense of the word. 

# Tasks
1. Generate the pinyin of the characters presented
2. Propose a short sentence in mandarin to illustrate the definition of the word.

# Notes
- Generate the output in JSON format following the example below:
{"pinyin": "CƒÅngk√π",
"sentence": "Âç°ËΩ¶ÊäµËææ‰ªìÂ∫ì„ÄÇ"}

- Be very diligent in thinking about the task being asked from you.
- Generate concise sentences as they need to fit in flash cards.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
## 1. Google Sheet Trigger & Translation using API
Trigger the workflow when the user adds a word in English in a new row of the column initialText.

### How to set up?
- **Trigger on Row Added of Google Sheet**:
   1. Add your Google Sheet API credentials to access the Google Sheet file
   2. Select the file using the list, an URL or an ID
   3. Select the sheet in which the vocabulary list is stored
  [Learn more about the Google Sheet on Row Added Trigger]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}
- **Google Translate API**:
   1. Add your Google Translate API credentials
   2. Select the target language *(Exemple: ZH-CN for Mainland China Mandarin)*
  [Learn more about the Google Translate API Node]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
## 2. Simple AI agent to get the phonetic transcription and generate an sentence example
The agent will take the translated word as an input and will output the phonetic transcription and the sentence.

### How to set up?
- **AI Agent with the Chat Model**:
   1. Add a chat model with the required credentials *(Example: Open AI 4o-mini)*
   2. Adapt the system prompt with the target translation language and the format of the sentence
  [Learn more about the AI Agent Node]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Add Results in Sheet
nodes.notes: initialtext, translation, sentence

nodes.name: Sticky Note4

parameters.content:
## 4. Combine Results to Update the Google Sheet
Combine initial text, translation, example sentence and image link to fill the new row.

### How to set up?
- **Add Results in Google Sheet**:
   1. Add your Google Sheet API credentials to access the Google Sheet file
   2. Select the file using the list, an URL or an ID
   3. Select the sheet in which the vocabulary list is stored
  [Learn more about the Google Sheet Node]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Stickynote Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Stickynote Workflow. This workflow integrates 14 different services: stickyNote, httpRequest, googleTranslate, googleSheetsTrigger, agent. It contains 31 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 31
- **Node Types**: 14
- **Error Handling**: ‚úÖ Implemented
- **Security**: ‚úÖ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ‚úÖ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Sticky Note3**: stickyNote
- **Google Translate**: googleTranslate
- **AI Agent**: agent
- **OpenAI Chat Model**: lmChatOpenAi
- **Structured Output Parser**: outputParserStructured
- **Merge**: merge
- **Trigger Added Row**: googleSheetsTrigger
- **No Operation, do nothing**: noOp
- **Upload Picture**: googleDrive
- **Get Picture**: httpRequest
- ... and 21 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
